results.title: Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis.
results.text_hl: SUMMARY: A 51-year-old white man (weight, 85 kg; height, 178 cm; body mass index, 28) with a history of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Low_Back_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017116 @@@low back pain@@@, and @DISEASE_Anxiety @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ apparently took 27 @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 10-mg tablets (3.18 mg/kg body weight) over a period of 3 or fewer days.

citations.NLM: Belay TW, Nusair AR. Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis. Am J Health Syst Pharm. 2013 Jul 15;70(14):1226-9. PMID: 23820459
citations.BibTeX: @article{23820459, title={Apparent lisinopril overdose requiring hemodialysis.}, author={Belay TW and Nusair AR}, journal={Am J Health Syst Pharm}, volume={70}, number={14}, pages={1226-9}}

results.title: Cheilitis glandularis in an African-American woman: response to antibiotic therapy.
results.text_hl: A 52-year-old black @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ presented with a 2-day history of @<m>DISEASE_Low_Back_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D017116 @@@lower@@@ @DISEASE_Lip_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D008047 @@@lip swelling@@@ 5 days after starting a new medication, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Bender MM, Rubenstein M, Rosen T. Cheilitis glandularis in an African-American woman: response to antibiotic therapy. Skinmed. 2005 Nov-Dec;4(6):391-2. PMID: 16276162
citations.BibTeX: @article{16276162, title={Cheilitis glandularis in an African-American woman: response to antibiotic therapy.}, author={Bender MM and Rubenstein M and Rosen T}, journal={Skinmed}, volume={4}, number={6}, pages={391-2}}
